alert.note: Alert for Butler; Preble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 5:58AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Preble and Butler counties in Ohio. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 557 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hamilton, Oxford, Trenton, Camden, Gratis, Seven Mile, West College Corner, Darrtown, Reily, College Corner, Somerville, West Elkton, Jacksonburg, Muttonville, Collinsville, Morning Sun, Hueston Woods State Park, Lake Lakengren, Sugar Valley and Fairhaven.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
